below the line.translation[0].definition: relating to profits after EXCEPTIONAL ITEMS (=profits and losses that are made in a particular period of time but do not occur regularly) have been taken into account
Provisions on doubtful property loans taken below the line reduced taxable profits to £3.95 million.
relating to a company’s spending on marketing activities other than advertising, for example research
Agencies offer strategic advice as well as below the line services like market research, pack design and direct marketing.
